member.name: KERB_ADD_BINDING_CACHE_ENTRY_EX_REQUEST
member.summary: Allows the user to bind to a specific domain controller (DC), overriding the Kerberos domain binding cache. Kerberos enforces a DC lookup when Dynamic Access Control (DAC) is enabled, so typically authentication is not bound to a specific DC. Certain users may want to bind to the specific DC on which they created an account or set a new password to avoid the DC replication delay. You must have the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set.

member.name: KERB_ADD_BINDING_CACHE_ENTRY_EX_REQUEST.MessageType
member.summary: A value of the enumeration that lists the types of messages that can be sent to the Kerberos authentication package by calling the function. This member must be set to KerbAddBindingCacheEntryExMessage.

member.name: KERB_ADD_BINDING_CACHE_ENTRY_EX_REQUEST.RealmName
member.summary: The name of the realm of the domain controller.

member.name: KERB_ADD_BINDING_CACHE_ENTRY_EX_REQUEST.KdcAddress
member.summary: The address of the Key Distribution Center (KDC) of the server to which you want to bind.

summary.para: The type of string that is contained in the KdcAddress member. This can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: The address is a string IP address of the domain controller, for example, "\\157.55.94.74").
The address is a NetBIOS name of the domain controller, for example, "\\phoenix".

member.name: KERB_ADD_BINDING_CACHE_ENTRY_EX_REQUEST.DcFlags
member.summary: The domain controller flags that the caller provides. These flags are needed to pass to the function.
